PenzeyMoog + Erdmann Wedding

Sick of the generic wedding websites I saw most of my friends make using prefab tools, I decided to try my hand at building something custom. I had played around with web design before, but this was my first attempt at building an entire website on my own.

I really wanted a nice single page structure with no scrolling, but needed to squeeze a good amount of information on the page, so I decided on an accordion structure, with fluid columns that resize on click.

Rather than use existing accordion structures I spend the time learning the fundamentals of jQuery and built my own. It ended up both much lighter on page load and significantly more gratifying.

My first print design object

I also worked up a thank you note design for us to send out after the wedding. This would have been a great opportunity to learn letterpress printing, which is something I've always wanted to do, but time and money had other plans.
